author: gstein
msg: Get the mailer.py script to generate diffs. Except for displaying
property changes, the output is comparable to commit-email.pl.
mailer.py is a little smarter about the labels it displays during a
diff (e.g. "(empty file") during add/delete, and the actual commit
date for the new/changed file).
Next up is the mail generation, removing os.popen() (insecure), and
loading in the configuration options.
* hook-scripts/mailer.py:
(main): pass the config to generate_content()
(generate_content): take a config. parse the svn date into a
standard ctime() representation. pass cfg to generate_diff.
(generate_diff): take a config. remove some obsolete code. generate
the appropriate FileDiff object and labels. run the diff.
* hook-scripts/mailer.conf.example: update the example 'diff' config

author: gstein
msg: Fix up some of the SWIG bindings, apply a tweak from Jon Middleton,
add some helpers to the python bindings, and extend fs.FileDiff to
return the temp files it opened rather than running diff.
* swig/svn_ra.i: include swigutil_*.h for any necessary helpers (for
example, the python bindings need the thread lock funcs)
* swig/svn_types.i: inclue svn_types.h in the C wrapper and make sure
the Java utilities are included.
Patch by: Jon Middleton <jjm@ixtab.org.uk>
(Only the svn_wc.i change below.)
* swig/svn_wc.i: svn_wc_status_t ** is an out parameter. handle the
output typemap application differently for svn_boolean_t (to
correct a ptr vs int mapping problem). make sure the utility
headers are included.
* swig/apr.i: revamp the 'apr_off_t *' typemap so we get the correct
types in the wrapping code (it was declaring the temp var as a
'long' but that threw off some assignments against apr_off_t). to
generate a bit more trim code, remove some braces and use double
quotes to denote the inserted code.
* swig/python/fs.py
(FileDiff.__init__): change the default for diffoptions to '' so
that we don't have to have a manual check in the code. simplify
the assert code. create a subpool for operation.
(FileDiff.get_files): refactored out of get_pipe to just create the
tmp files. simplify the writing of the files. clear the subpool.
(FileDiff.get_pipe): refactored to use self.get_files()
* swig/python/util.py
(secs_from_timestr): convert an SVN ISO8601 time string into a
number of seconds from the Unix epoch (Python time seconds).

author: gstein
msg: Some simple mods to bring the code up to the current codebase.
* mailer.py:
- change imports to be full-qualfied (e.g. svn.fs.FOO). all users
changed.
main(): wrap_editor isn't needed any more.

author: striker
msg: *  subversion/libsvn_delta/diff.c
(svn_diff__position_t): Add a prev field.
(svn_diff__get_tokens): Create a double linked list instead
of a single one.
(svn_diff__snake_forward): Renamed from svn_diff__snake.
(svn_diff__snake_reverse): Mirrors the behaviour of svn_diff__snake_forward.
(svn_diff__recover_lcs): Given the diagonal the overlapping forward
and reverse longest common subsequences were found, construct the
complete lcs and return it.
(svn_diff__lcs): Partly implement Variation 4b from Meyers paper:
"An O(ND) Difference Algorithm and Its Variations".  Don't do linear
space LCS recovery, instead only take advantage of scanning of both
ends of the sequences being compared.

author: kfogel
msg: Fix problem introduced in revision 4282:
* subversion/libsvn_fs/reps-strings.c
(empty_digest): For now, initialize to all zeros; before, we were
storing the checksum for the empty string initially, but then
not updating it, which is bad.
(svn_fs__rep_undeltify): Return the error if checksums don't match.
Previously, we created an error, but forgot to return it.
(checksums_match): Keep a #if'd out debugging printf here.
